DOC.brief_summary: This study aim investigate effectiveness in-person peer mentor health literacy intervention improve medication adherence , HIV-1 viral load , CD4+ T lymphocyte count , HIV medical appointment attendance among newly-diagnosed and/or medication non-adherent HIV-positive individual , compare standard care provider/staff-delivered education .
DOC.brief_title: A Pilot Study Examine Efficacy Peer Mentoring Promoting Medication Adherence Among People Living With HIV/AIDS
DOC.criteria: All following criterion must meet participant eligible study : Confirmed diagnosis HIV1 Newly diagnose initiate treatment ( e.g. , treatment naive ) OR medication fourteen consecutive day ( 2 week ) reinitiating treatment OR currently antiretroviral therapy demonstrate ongoing adherence problem ( miss 3 dos per month ) Has detectable ( great 50 copies/ml ) HIV1 viral load Is able obtain HIV medication entire study period ( e.g. , uninsured , enrolled AIDS Drug Assistance Program ) . Subject ineligible study : He/She suffers cognitive impairment , active psychosis , know history harm others , OR He/She severe mental health and/or substance abuse condition require residential inpatient treatment , OR The medical provider believe participation would best interest subject reason .
